newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SOLVAY SAYS NO SISE CAM DEAL YET.
newsitem.headline: SOLVAY SAYS NO SISE CAM DEAL YET.

text.p: Belgian chemicals group Solvay on Tuesday dismissed as premature comments by Turkish glassware producer Sise Cam that Sise Cam would buy 25 percent of Solvay's 60 percent stake in Bulgarian soda ash producer SODI.
"The news is premature - there is no deal yet," Solvay spokesman Paul Muys told Reuters. He confirmed that negotiations were taking place, but declined to give details.
In December Solvay signed a preliminary agreement with Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency allowing it to acquire 60 percent of SODI for $160 million.

Earlier on Tuesday Sise Cam's general manager told a news conference in Istanbul that in buying 25 percent of Solvay's stake, Sise Cam would own about 17 percent of SODI and get about 250,000 tonnes of its production.
